item.title: Problems with renamed loading models
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“laakerules, post:5, topic:416782”]Here is one of my simple ints in my client!

if (i == 15163) {
	itemDef.modelID = 28;
	itemDef.name = "Katana";
	itemDef.modelZoom = 1300;
	itemDef.modelRotation1 = 1400;
	itemDef.modelRotation2 = 90;
	itemDef.modelOffset1 = 6;
	itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4;
	itemDef.stackable = false;
	itemDef.value = 1;
	itemDef.membersObject = true;
	itemDef.maleEquip1 = 28;
	itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 28;
	itemDef.actions = new String[5];
	itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield";
	itemDef.actions[4] = "Drop";
	itemDef.editedModelColor = new int[6];
	itemDef.newModelColor = new int[6];
	itemDef.editedModelColor[0] = 61;
	itemDef.newModelColor[0] = 528;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[1] = 6550;
	itemDef.newModelColor[1] = 0;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[2] = 6430;
	itemDef.newModelColor[2] = 17350;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[3] = 100;
	itemDef.newModelColor[3] = 17350;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[4] = 926;
	itemDef.newModelColor[4] = 17350;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[5] = 0;
	itemDef.newModelColor[5] = 17350;
	itemDef.anInt175 = 16;
	itemDef.anInt197 = 8;

}

You were missing the wearing ints

And if that doesnt work, can you post the model.java lines 190 through 210 i could help alot more![/quote]This is from line 190 to 210

int l = 0; int i1 = 0; for(int j1 = 0; j1 < anInt1626; j1++) { int k1 = stream.readUnsignedByte(); int i2 = 0; if((k1 & 1) != 0) i2 = stream_1.method421(); int k2 = 0; if((k1 & 2) != 0) k2 = stream_2.method421(); int i3 = 0; if((k1 & 4) != 0) i3 = stream_3.method421(); anIntArray1627[j1] = k + i2; anIntArray1628[j1] = l + k2; anIntArray1629[j1] = i1 + i3; k = anIntArray1627[j1]; l = anIntArray1628[j1]; i1 = anIntArray1629[j1]; if(anIntArray1655 != null)

Read full topic

item.title: Problems with renamed loading models
item.dc:creator: @laakerules laakerules
item.description:
@laakerules wrote:

Here is one of my simple ints in my client!

if (i == 15163) {
	itemDef.modelID = 28;
	itemDef.name = "Katana";
	itemDef.modelZoom = 1300;
	itemDef.modelRotation1 = 1400;
	itemDef.modelRotation2 = 90;
	itemDef.modelOffset1 = 6;
	itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4;
	itemDef.stackable = false;
	itemDef.value = 1;
	itemDef.membersObject = true;
	itemDef.maleEquip1 = 28;
	itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 28;
	itemDef.actions = new String[5];
	itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield";
	itemDef.actions[4] = "Drop";
	itemDef.editedModelColor = new int[6];
	itemDef.newModelColor = new int[6];
	itemDef.editedModelColor[0] = 61;
	itemDef.newModelColor[0] = 528;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[1] = 6550;
	itemDef.newModelColor[1] = 0;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[2] = 6430;
	itemDef.newModelColor[2] = 17350;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[3] = 100;
	itemDef.newModelColor[3] = 17350;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[4] = 926;
	itemDef.newModelColor[4] = 17350;
	itemDef.editedModelColor[5] = 0;
	itemDef.newModelColor[5] = 17350;
	itemDef.anInt175 = 16;
	itemDef.anInt197 = 8;

}

You were missing the wearing ints

And if that doesnt work, can you post the model.java lines 190 through 210 i could help alot more!

item.title: Problems with renamed loading models
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Mitko, post:3, topic:416782”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=518720.msg3769596#msg3769596 date=1317560373]
Your missing some lines in your ints it seems, correct me if i’m wrong, but there should be stuff like:

=> itemDef.stackable =

=> itemDef.femaleEquip1 =

=> itemDef.maleEquip1 =
etc.
[/quote]I don’t have the male and female equip ints, it doesn’t recognize them. I also have a feeling it may be cause of it. Do you know where i can get them?[/quote]
Sorry, adding customs is not my thing, if I had the ints, I would give them but I don’t srry

Read full topic

item.title: Problems with renamed loading models
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

Done clienthax’s model preloading with no errors or client startup errors, it seems to read the file from the models folder but the problem is when it’s picked up ingame.

Here’s an example of the ints:

if(i == 358) { itemDef.name = "Korasi's sword"; itemDef.description = "The sword of a Void Knight.".getBytes(); itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 57784; itemDef.modelZoom = 1400; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 700; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 25; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 60; }

And here’s the problems when using ::pickup

Has anyone else been through the same?

Read full topic
